name: Hilton Long Beach & Executive Meeting Center

reviews.text: This was a very nice hotel, within walking distance of everything. very clean and layed out very well. price was a bit high but probably in line for the area. Room service was quick and very good and the resturaunt on site was accomodating and enjoyable.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I decided to go on a mini vacation and chose Long Beach because it was not to far from Riverside, CA and we wanted to visit the Aquarium. We arrived 2/19 between 2-3pm and found our room ready. We stayed 2 days in Room 921. The Lobby is very nice and our check-in was quite easy with the staff being very friendly and helpful. The desk clerk gave us a map of the area and told us where the best self parking was for our room. Self Parking is still at $17/day and Internet access is $9.95/day. Our room was very clean and comfortable. Liked the fact that we could open the window for fresh air. The TV was nice, with HBO, Current movies (still in theaters) available for a fee, also Account and Checkout Access via remote. Speaker phones, refrigerator, coffee machine, safe, ironing board and iron, hairdryer and bathroom amenities were welcomed. Restaurant seemed pricey and found it difficult to find fast food or grocery store without traveling to older part of town. We were hoping to grab the shuttle to the aquarium the following day to avoid more parking charges, but were told the shuttle would not return until after 3:30pm that day. We parked for $8 at the aquarium. Overall we had a great time even though the hotel is more fitting for business. Upon arriving home we discovered we had left a small suitcase in the closet. We called the hotel and left our number and were told that “lost and found” would be returning our call. A very nice woman from lost and found called us back promptly. She described our lost suitcase and informed us that we could have it mailed to us. After taking down our credit card info I asked her to mail it “regular mail” (hoping it will be less than the gas back and forth). So now I guess we'll wait and see. Will post again if there is a problem with the luggage return. Feeling like such a fool right now. Never left luggage before. Anyway I would highly recommend this hotel when visiting Long Beach!..........Vincent Russell
reviews.title: Great stay even after left suitcase!!

reviews.text: Evaluating strictly from a business stay perspective with HHonors Diamond perspective, meaning I don't care about things like valet, bell or concierge service but do care about a few other critical items.
reviews.title: Business stay evaluation

reviews.text: Positives:
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, great for the price

reviews.text: 1. Staff helpful and friendly
reviews.title: Rude and not helpful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is perfect, the rooms are clean and nice, and the lobby is professional - Just the consistency I expect from Hilton.
reviews.title: Typical Hilton Quality!

reviews.text: Only problem was the noise in the halls after midnight and before 7am from rude guests in the hallway. Our floor had a bunch of teenager and pre-teen cheerleader staying for some competition and the parents obviously never taught them manners. I suggest Hilton Up their prices as the riff raff is slipping in.
reviews.title: Close to Port of Long Beach for Cruise

reviews.text: Other than that I really enjoyed mt stay.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Clean and comfortable
Good Hotel for a Business Trip
reviews.text: Note that the parking was a crazy $17 a night, but downtown Long Beach its expected to be something. Why does Hilton still charge $10 a day for WIFI when the budget motels give it away for free?????

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pine street is walking distance and so is the Pike.
reviews.title: Substantially Disappointing

reviews.text: Room was terrible
reviews.title: Room was terrible with bad ventilation. Customer service at front desk was also a joke.

reviews.text: Customer service was terrible
reviews.title: JamFest Nationals

reviews.text: Food was nasty at buffet
reviews.title: Just okay hotel in a just okay part of long beach

reviews.text: Will not stay at this location.
reviews.title: Nice Business Hotel in Long Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Um, would not recommend this place again.
reviews.title: Annual Fred Hall fishing convention

reviews.text: Decent Hilton for business, but had the wife and kids and the room and amenities can't match that type of travel. Room is mallet, no drawers in room, and only one overpriced restaurant. Not knocking the hotel fr business, but other choices are better if you are not solo, or staying more than 48 hours.
reviews.title: Purely business

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We picked this hotel because it was close to Catalina Landing for the Catalina Express. We were told it had a heated pool/spa. When we arrived, we discovered, the pool is not heated, and spa was closed for maintence. A double whammy, and a very big disappointment!
reviews.title: Pool not heated, spa closed for maintence.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant was empty on a Saturday night. Which did allow us to get any table we wanted. After looking over the menu, and sampling the food, discovered why the place is empty.
reviews.title: Hilton Long Beach CA

reviews.text: The room was nice, clean, and comfortable. And it is very close to Catalina Landing.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!!!

reviews.text: And be prepared to pay $17 to $20 extra to park your car at this hotel!
reviews.title: Great Long Beach Vacation place

aka: Hilton Long Beach & Executive Meeting Hotel Long Beach
